intro: Brucea dubia, commonly known as the Indian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Brucea dubia is known for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional medicine. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, black seeds.
